definition: to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across
a danger concealed within sth/hidden damage/misfortune not visible from the surface

internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad

sentences.english: This patient developed severe hepatitis with hepatic decompensation.
sentences.chinese: 該例患者患了重症肝炎，肝臟失代償。

sentences.english: Are vegans really at greater risk of B12 deficiency?
sentences.chinese: 純素食者患維生素B12缺乏症的風險真的很高嗎？

sentences.english: He died of a stroke, same as Grandma.
sentences.chinese: 和外婆一樣，他也是患中風死的。

sentences.english: He is down with a nasty bout of flu.
sentences.chinese: 他患了一陣子感冒，很難受。

sentences.chinese: 入院後檢查發現寶寶患的是肺炎球菌性支氣管肺炎。

sentences.english: I learned that he was suffering from cancer.

sentences.english: He conked out in November with pleurisy.
sentences.chinese: 他患肋膜炎於十一月份死去。

sentences.english: It can lead to inflammation of the pancreas, which increases your risk of diabetes.

sentences.english: And women who are more than ninety-one percent rate caries.
sentences.chinese: 而女性患齲率則超過百分之九十一。

sentences.english: Some students in the system have multiple disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 這些視障學生當中的一些學生患多重殘疾。

sentences.english: Li Yapeng said that the little girl had been born with a cleft lip in his blog in August.
sentences.chinese: 李亞鵬於8月份在其博客上公開了女兒患脣裂的消息。

sentences.english: The researchers suggest that she could have been genetically predisposed to heart problems.
sentences.chinese: 研究生認爲有可能她天生由於遺傳因素就易患心臟病。

sentences.english: To the non-ADHD partner, the interruptions are disrespectful.
sentences.chinese: 對於沒有患多動症的一方，打斷就意味着不尊重。
